_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Check valves, fill valves, safety relief valves, transfer hoses, auto-shutoff connection
_prev_prog_3.Description:
This prevention program covers four LPG co-located storage vessels. While not interconnected, these vessels are stored in close enough proximity to one another that a catastrophic event could potentially effect another. Each vessel supplies a filling station manifold located in the same building that is used to fill DOT cylinders ranging in size from 500 lbs. to 20 lbs. Because each product (butane, isobutane, and propane) have similar characteristics, equipment, maintenance, and are used in the same ways, the single prevention program will suffice for mitigating and preventing offsite (and onsite) incidents. 



For each product, the same preventative measures and equipment are utilized. The same hazards are present for each and atmospheric differences (in the event of a release or catastrophic event) are negligible and are only discernible on a molecular level. Therefore, training, emergency response, and other procedures may be used interchangeably between products, with respect to the final product being transferred into the portable containers (DOT cylinders). 



Primary prevention measures are for mitigating uncontrolled releases through manual valves, relief valves, and auto-shutoffs. Fire prevention measures include grounding wires and flash arrestors. 



Approximate maximum capacity of each storage vessel:

Bulk tank #1: Butane (approx. 70,000 lbs)

Bulk tank #2: Propane (approx. 40,000 lbs.)

Bulk tank #3: Isobutane (approx. 45,000 lbs.)

Bulk tank #4: 70% butane, 30% propane mix (approx. 33,000 lbs. of butane, 12,000 lbs. of propane - 45,000 lbs total product)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for OXARC, Inc.

1530 Dietrich Rd.

Pasco, WA 99301



Storage and Filling of Butane, Propane, Isobutane and mixtures of LPGs. 



1.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

We are OXARC, Inc. are strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This commitment is demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such as receipt of containers and product, storage, and employee training associated with the chemicals at this facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances for the safety of our employees and the public. 



Under the "Accidental Release Prevention Program," responsibility for the proper handling and storage of flammable gases stored and used at this facility is given to the production supervisor and overseen by the Safety and Compliance Manager. Additionally, OXARC, Inc. senior management have responsibility to ensure facility managers, supervisors and the Safety and Compliance Manager keep the program up-to-date and that all reports and findings are taken care of in a timely manner.



2.    The Regulated Substances Handled

The facility is typically minimally occupied and is used for filling filling LPG gases and other company activities. There are three substances stored at the facility above the regulatory threshold (butane, propane, and isobutane) as well as a single bulk storage tank of an LPG mix (70% butane, 30% propane). Each is filled at this facility out of the bulk storage tanks and into the cylinders which are then distributed to our wholesalers and retail facilities for sale. The most common size cylinders filled are 100 lbs. cylinders. The largest size cylinder filled are 500 lbs cylinders which are occasionally filled.



3.    General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

This facility has taken all of the necessary steps to comply with the ac

cidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place at this facility.



Process Safety Information

OXARC, Inc. maintains safety information that describes the chemical hazards, handling, storage, and usage of the regulated substance at this facility. In addition, engineered drawings are available for reference and to help mitigate any operational or maintenance procedures. 



Process Hazard Analysis

This facility conducts reviews to ensure that hazards associated with the handling, storage, and filling of cylinders are identified and controlled efficiently. Any findings related the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner. The most recent PHA review was preformed upon installation, 10/1/2020.



Operating Procedures

For the purpose of safely handling, filling, and storing cylinders, OXARC, Inc. has written procedures that address the production of filling LPGs.



Training

OXARC, Inc. has a comprehensive program in place to ensure employees who are responsible for the handling of hazardous substances are competent in the procedures. Refresher training is provided on an ongoing basis. Procedures provided via the Propane Education and Research Council with additional OTJ training provided.



Mechanical Integrity

OXARC, Inc. takes great care in ensuring that the structural integrity of the containers and cylinders is maintained throughout the handling and storage of these containers, cylinders, and any equipment associated with the process. Each cylinder is inspected prior to filling and additional maintenance is performed as necessary.



Management of Change

The most recent review/revision of procedures was performed on 5/4/2020. Employees whose job tasks are affected by a modification in the operating procedures are promptly made aware of and trained in these changes.



Compliance Audits

Compliance audits are performed on an on

going schedule (every three years) with the last one completed on 10/5/18. The goal of each compliance audit should be to identify areas which may need correction or improvements. Each action item identified is given a timeline for completion. 



Incident Investigation

OXARC, Inc. promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could result in an unintentional release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of 5 years. There have been no incidents associated with this facility.



Employee Participation

OXARC, Inc. believes that safety management and accident prevention is a team effort. OXARC employees are included in decisions as they pertain to the covered processes and are encouraged to express their views concerning accident prevention issues and to recommend improvements. In addition, our employees have access to all information created as part of this facility's implementation of the RMP rule, including information resulting from any hazard analyses. 



Contractors

On occasion, OXARC, Inc. hires contractors to conduct specialized maintenance and construction activities. Prior to selecting a contractor, a thorough evaluation of safety of the contractor is carried out. OXARC has a strict policy of informing the contractors of known potential hazards related to the contractors work and the processes. Contractors are also informed of all the procedures for emergency response should an accidental release occur.



4.    Five-Year Accident History

There have been no accidents to report.



5.    Emergency Response Plan

OXARC, Inc. has an Emergency Response Plan for the facility which includes general information and actions to take in the event of an emergency. The plan includes all required aspects of an Emergency Action Plan and was modified with the intent to best st

reamline the actions to take following an emergency. The plan identifies alerts and notifications, what to do in the event of an emergency, evacuation, extinguishers, operations, employee duties, and meeting points and accountability.



Franklin County LEPC is the Local Emergency Planning Committee covering this facility. The Pasco Fire Department are the primary first responders for this facility.



6.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

OXARC, Inc. has no plans at the present time.
